scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: While writer-in-residence at the University of Virginia, Porter writes about her hectic schedule that prevents a visit and mentions a request to speak to a local literary club for a small fee. Two letters written from Martha Jefferson Hospital, where Porter was hospitalized for pneumonia, thank Moore for gifts. A final letter discusses making up speaking engagements her illness forced her to postpone and mentions a stay at the English Dept. of Washington and Lee.

did.unittitle: Katherine Anne Porter, University of Virginia, to Virginia Moore, Scottsville, Virginia. 1958 Oct 6

scopecontent.p: [writes that she is unable to spare the time for a personal visit due to her hectic shedule as a writer in residence at the University of Virginia and expresses shock at the request of a local writer for her to speak at a literary club for a small monetary consideration when she usually is paid between five hundred and a thousand dollars depending on the circumstances]

did.unittitle: Katherine Anne Porter, Martha Jefferson Hospital, Charlottesville, to Virginia Moore, "Cliffside," Scottsville, Virginia. 1958 Dec 6

scopecontent.p: [writing while hospitalized for pneumonia, Porter thanks Moore for the persimmons and the book on the text of Meleager [the 1st century B.C. Greek epigrammatist ?], and tells her "go on being beautiful and loving the human race. I don't love it at all, except just a few I couldn't live without!"]

did.unittitle: Katherine Anne Porter, Martha Jefferson Hospital, Charlottesville, to Virginia Moore, Scottsville. 1958 Dec 10

scopecontent.p: [thanks her for the thoughtful note and flowers, believes she is getting better, and writes, "What a germ can do to the soul is what bothers me!"]

did.unittitle: Katherine Anne Porter, Charlottesville, Virginia, to Virginia Moore, Washington, D.C. 1959 Jan 26

scopecontent.p: [regrets that she has missed seeing Moore during her convalescence and the time she spent making up missed engagements because of it, and mentions packing for a stay at the English Department, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, Virginia, and a trip to the Polytechnic Institute at Auburn, Alabama, for a reading the next night]
